title: Fresh clone of repo followed by `pytest` fails
body:

### What is wrong?

I cloned the repo and wanted to run the tests for the first time following: https://py-evm.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing.html#setting-the-stage.

Once inside a virtualenv, I ran `pip install -e .[dev]` and did not get any errors.

I then ran `pytest` and got three errors as it went to collect tests:

```
============================================================================================================ test session starts =============================================================================================================
platform darwin -- Python 3.6.5, pytest-3.6.4, py-1.7.0, pluggy-0.7.1
rootdir: /src/py-evm, inifile: pytest.ini
plugins: xdist-1.18.1, cov-2.5.1, asyncio-0.9.0, asyncio-network-simulator-0.1.0a2, hypothesis-3.69.5
collected 56294 items / 3 errors / 1 skipped

=================================================================================================================== ERRORS ===================================================================================================================
_________________________________________________________________________________________ ERROR collecting tests/core/validation/test_validation.py __________________________________________________________________________________________
import file mismatch:
imported module 'test_validation' has this __file__ attribute:
  /src/py-evm/tests/beacon/test_validation.py
which is not the same as the test file we want to collect:
  /src/py-evm/tests/core/validation/test_validation.py
HINT: remove __pycache__ / .pyc files and/or use a unique basename for your test file modules
______________________________________________________________________________________________ ERROR collecting tests/database/test_chaindb.py _______________________________________________________________________________________________
import file mismatch:
imported module 'test_chaindb' has this __file__ attribute:
  /src/py-evm/tests/beacon/db/test_chaindb.py
which is not the same as the test file we want to collect:
  /src/py-evm/tests/database/test_chaindb.py
HINT: remove __pycache__ / .pyc files and/or use a unique basename for your test file modules
____________________________________________________________________________________ ERROR collecting tests/trinity/integration/test_plugin_discovery.py _____________________________________________________________________________________
ImportError while importing test module '/src/py-evm/tests/trinity/integration/test_plugin_discovery.py'.
Hint: make sure your test modules/packages have valid Python names.
Traceback:
tests/trinity/integration/test_plugin_discovery.py:7: in <module>
    from peer_count_reporter_plugin import PeerCountReporterPlugin
E   ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'peer_count_reporter_plugin'
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Interrupted: 3 errors during collection !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
==================================================================================================== 1 skipped, 3 error in 19.96 seconds =====================================================================================================
```

### How can it be fixed

I fixed the plugin error with `pip install -e trinity-external-plugins/examples/peer_count_reporter`.

Should we add this to the docs? Or is it supposed to install with the original `pip install` and it is not working for some reason?

The other two may require a name change to avoid collisions -- I'll defer to those who have touched those files to chime in.

Thank you for bringing that to our attention again. You aren't the first to run into this and so I just proposed a PR to only run this test when the `--integration` flag is explicitly passed. https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/pull/1649

I think we should clean-up (rename these test modules) to fix these two errors:

```
import file mismatch:
imported module 'test_validation' has this file attribute:
/src/py-evm/tests/beacon/test_validation.py
which is not the same as the test file we want to collect:
/src/py-evm/tests/core/validation/test_validation.py
HINT: remove pycache / .pyc files and/or use a unique basename for your test file modules
______________________________________________________________________________________________ ERROR collecting tests/database/test_chaindb.py _______________________________________________________________________________________________
import file mismatch:
imported module 'test_chaindb' has this file attribute:
/src/py-evm/tests/beacon/db/test_chaindb.py
which is not the same as the test file we want to collect:
/src/py-evm/tests/database/test_chaindb.py
HINT: remove pycache / .pyc files and/or use a unique basename for your test file modules
```

- `test_validation.py` -> `test_beacon_validation.py` / `test_eth1_validation.py`
- `test_chaindb` -> `test_beacon_chaindb.py` / `test_eth1_chaindb.py`

@pipermerriam yep totally -- didn't realize the code blocks would handle off panel scrolling (thanks github!)

and those names sound good to me... i'll be eagerly awaiting to `pytest` :)

FYI i went ahead and implemented those changes (https://github.com/ethereum/py-evm/issues/1646#issuecomment-448686503) in #1660 .

Happy to discuss further changes if anyone has further input.
Is the issue still present?.. PR #1660 purported to address the last part of it.
@veox it seems like this issue has been resolved, just tried from a fresh install and had no problems getting the tests to run, as far as i can tell the above activity fixed the original issue
